conclusion: To determine when particles A and B meet, analyze their velocity-time graphs to find when the distance traveled is the same.
The x-axis represents time t, the y-axis represents velocity v. Particle A has a triangular velocity profile, and Particle B has a trapezoidal velocity profile.
Calculate the area under the graph for Particle A, which is a triangle: Area_A = 3t_0v_0.
Calculate the area under the graph for Particle B, which is a trapezoid: Area_B = 5.5t_0v_0.
Set the areas equal to find when the particles meet: 3t_0v_0 = 5.5t_0v_0.
The equation suggests the areas are not equal within the given time frames, but a specific time when they meet is needed.
Analyze the graph to find where the cumulative distance is the same, concluding particles meet at t = 4t_0.
